title: CRISPR-associated genomic element detector
description: This feature specifically detects CRISPR repeat regions and potentially other defense-related genomic elements in bacterial genomes. The feature shows strong, localized activation directly at or immediately adjacent to CRISPR repeats when they are annotated. In examples without explicit CRISPR annotations, the activation pattern is similar and often occurs near hypothetical proteins that may be unannotated CRISPR-associated elements. The biological function represented is likely related to bacterial adaptive immunity systems, particularly the CRISPR-Cas defense mechanism against foreign genetic elements. The pattern is highly consistent across examples, with sharp, defined activation peaks of similar shape and intensity in the vicinity of CRISPR elements or related genomic regions.
